allow-flight.name: Allow Flight
allow-flight.description: Allows users to use flight on the server while in Survival mode

allow-nether.name: Allow Nether
allow-nether.description: Allows players to travel to the Nether

broadcast-console-to-ops.name: Broadcast Console To OPS
broadcast-console-to-ops.description: Send console command outputs to all online operators.

broadcast-rcon-to-ops.name: Broadcast RCON to OPS
broadcast-rcon-to-ops.description: Send rcon console command outputs to all online operators.

enable-jmx-monitoring.name: Enable JMX Monitoring
enable-jmx-monitoring.description: Exposes an MBean with the Object name net.minecraft.server:type=Server.

enable-status.name: Enable Status
enable-status.description: Makes the server appear as online on the server list.

enable-query.name: Enable Query
enable-query.description: Enables GameSpy4 protocol server listener. Used to get information about server.

entity-broadcast-range-percentage.name: Entity Broadcast Range Percentage
entity-broadcast-range-percentage.description: Controls how close entities need to be before being sent to clients

force-gamemode.name: Force Gamemode
force-gamemode.description: Force players to join in the default game mode.

function-permission-level.name: Function Permission Level
function-permission-level.description: Sets the default permission level for functions.

generate-structures.name: Generate Structures
generate-structures.description: Defines whether structures (such as villages) can be generated.

generator-settings.name: Generator Settings
generator-settings.description: The settings used to customize world generation.

level-name.name: Level-Name
level-name.description: The level-name value is used as the world name and its folder name.

level-seed.name: Level Seed
level-seed.description: Sets a world seed for the player's world. Leave blank for random generation.

level-type.name: Level Type
level-type.description: Determines the type of map that is generated.

max-build-height.name: Max Build Height
max-build-height.description: The maximum height allowed for building. Max: 256  Min: 16

max-players.name: Max Players
max-players.description: The maximum number of players that can play on the server at the same time.

max-tick-time.name: Max Tick Time
max-tick-time.description: The maximum number of milliseconds a single tick may take before the server stops

max-world-size.name: Max World Size
max-world-size.description: This sets the maximum possible world size in blocks (radius)

motd.name: MOTD
motd.description: This is the message that is displayed in the server list of the client, below the name.

online-mode.name: Online Mode
online-mode.description: Server checks connecting players against Minecraft account database.

op-permission-level.name: OP Permission Level
op-permission-level.description: Sets the default permission level for ops when using /op.

player-idle-timeout.name: Player Idle Timeout
player-idle-timeout.description: Set player timeout for inactivity (in minutes)

prevent-proxy-connections.name: Prevent Proxy Connections
prevent-proxy-connections.description: Prevents players using proxies/VPNs from joining

query.port.name: Query Port
query.port.description: Sets the port for the query server (see enable-query).

rate-limit.name: Rate Limit
rate-limit.description: Sets the maximum amount of packets a user can send before getting kicked

resource-pack.name: Resource Pack URL
resource-pack.description: Optional URI to a resource pack. The player may choose to use it.

resource-pack-prompt.name: Resource Pack Prompt
resource-pack-prompt.description: Optional, adds a custom message to be shown on resource pack prompt when require-resource-pack is used.

resource-pack-sha1.name: Resource Pack Prompt
resource-pack-sha1.description: Checks integrity of resource pack using a hash.

require-resource-pack.name: Require Resource Pack
require-resource-pack.description: When this option is enabled (set to true), players will be prompted for a response and will be disconnected if they decline the required pack.

server-ip.name: Server IP
server-ip.description: The player should set this if they want the server to bind to a particular IP.

server-port.name: Server Port
server-port.description: Changes the port the server is hosting (listening) on.

snooper-enabled.name: Snooper-Enabled
snooper-enabled.description: Sets whether the server sends snoop data regularly to http://snoop.minecraft.net.

spawn-protection.name: Spawn Protection
spawn-protection.description: Determines the side length of the square spawn protection area as 2x+1.

use-native-transport.name: Use Native Transport
use-native-transport.description: Linux server performance improvements: optimized packet sending/receiving on Linux

view-distance.name: View Distance
view-distance.description: Maximum view distance allowed for the client.

white-list.name: White-list
white-list.description: Enables a whitelist on the server.

enforce-whitelist.name: Enforce Whitelist
enforce-whitelist.description: Enforces the whitelist on the server.

jarFile.name: Server JAR
jarFile.description: Name of the Server's JAR File

name.name: Friendly Server Name
name.description: A friendly name used to identify the server
